sub_topic: The construction of the Peano curve.
message_1: How long is the Peano curve that passes through the unit square from $(0,0)$ to $(1,1)$?
message_2: The Peano curve is a space-filling curve, which means it is a continuous curve that passes through every point in a given space, in this case, the unit square. Since it is a space-filling curve, it has no well-defined length. In other words, the length of the Peano curve is infinite.
